control_classes

Class Collision

  • java.lang.Object
    • control_classes.Collision

  • public class Collision
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to determine the new position of the ball when a collision has been detected This class is an abstract class with no contructor and simply methods Created by niles on 24/03/2017.

    • Method Detail

      • checkCollisions

        public CollisionStruct checkCollisions(gameObject ball,
                                       gameObject shape,
                                       javafx.scene.Group root,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<gameObject> gameArray,
                                       int pos,
                                       GameSounds sounds,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        checkCollisions will take in a number of parameters to determine if a collision has occured on the ball
        Parameters:
        ball - - the ball object in the game; Ball
        shape - - the shape representation of the game of the game; Shape
        root - - the group of shapes contained in the scene; Group
        gameArray - - an Arraylist of gameObjects in the game; Arraylist
        pos - -
        sounds - - the sounds used in the game for when a collision does occur; GameSounds
        players - - an Arraylist of the players; Arraylist
        Returns:
        Returns a a set of locational and positional values so that if a collision does occur it does not need to check where the ball needs to be again; CollisionStruct
